name.baseName: Municipal sludge treatment and disposal;dry sludge;dewatering
市政污泥处理与处置;干污泥;脱水

dataSetInformation.common:generalComment: The main data sources used in our study are as follows: 1) Energy consumption and material inputs are obtained from investigations in Tai Lake Watershed; 2) The energy use emission factor is obtained from our own calculation, IPCC, and the literature.3) The fugitive emissions during landfilling, incineration, and composting are mainly determined by the model given in the other study as well as by the IPCC factors (2006), except for the CH4 emission in landfilling, which is obtained from study.4) Data from theoretical calculations (see Incineration section).
本文研究的主要数据来源如下:1)能源消耗和物质投入来源于对太湖流域的调查;2)能源利用排放因子来源于我们自己的计算、IPCC和文献。3)填埋过程中的CH4排放由文献获得，填埋、焚烧和堆肥过程中的无组织排放主要由文献研究中给出的模型和IPCC因子(2006)决定。4)理论计算数据(焚烧部分)。

quantitativeReference.functionalUnitOrOther: The functional unit used for GHGs in this LCA is one dry ton (DT) of sludge.

technology.technologyDescriptionAndIncludedProcesse: According to the operating data, about 12.7 tons of cement is produced per ton of the dried sludge considering the combustion loss in the kiln
采用“先进板框压滤机”对污泥进行压滤，降低污泥含水量，在原污泥中添加5kg /DT的聚合絮凝剂。
technology.technologicalApplicability: The described process is utilized for the treatment and disposal of municipal sludge specifically within the Tai Lake Watershed area. The process involves dewatering of the sludge to produce dry sludge suitable for further processing or final disposal. The data associated with this process may be applied to assess environmental impacts in systemswhere treatment and management of municipal waste sludge is a component, especially when assessing greenhouse gas emissions on a per dry ton basis.
所描述的过程用于太湖流域地区市政污泥的处理和处置。该过程涉及污泥的脱水作业，以产生适合进一步处理或最终处置的干污泥。与此过程相关的数据可以用于评估系统中市政废弃污泥处理和管理的环境影响，特别是在以每干吨为基础评估温室气体排放时。

referenceToDataSource.common:shortDescription: Liu, B., Wei, Q., Zhang, B. & Bi, J. Life cycle GHG emissions of sewage sludge treatment and disposal options in Tai Lake Watershed, China. Science of The Total Environment 447, 361–369 (2013).
Liu, B., Wei, Q., Zhang, B. & Bi, J. Life cycle GHG emissions of sewage sludge treatment and disposal options in Tai Lake Watershed, China. Science of The Total Environment 447, 361–369 (2013).

dataSourcesTreatmentAndRepresentativenes.useAdviceForDataSet: When using this dataset for Life Cycle Assessment, ensure inclusion of all relevant lifecycle stages of sludge treatment and disposal. Pay particular attention to the methodological appropriateness of the data especially regarding the Tai Lake Watershed context. Consider the representativeness of the data for the specific geographic region and time period. It is advised to account for technology variations and operational practices that may affect greenhouse gas emissions. The functional unit of one dry ton of sludge should be consistently applied across the assessment.
在使用此数据集进行生命周期评估时，请确保包括污泥处理和处置的所有相关生命周期阶段。特别关注数据的方法学适用性，尤其是关于太湖流域背景的数据。考虑数据对特定地理区域和时间段的代表性。建议考虑技术变化和可能影响温室气体排放的操作实践。功能单位为一干吨污泥，应在整个评估过程中保持一致应用。

review.common:reviewDetails: Inventory: The internal review was done by several iteration steps concerning raw data validation, raw data documentation, representativity, completeness and consistency of modelling with regard to ISO 14040 and 14044.
清单： 内部审查通过几个迭代步骤完成，涉及原始数据验证、原始数据记录、代表性、完整性、与 ISO 14040 和 14044 有关的建模的一致性。

publicationAndOwnership.common:licenseType: Free of charge for all users and uses
